The moment of inertia of a body about an axis is the sum of the products of the masses of the particles of which the body is composed and the squares of their distances from the axis. Thus—

blocks.description: This equation represents the moment of inertia of a body, where I is the moment of inertia, m is the mass of each particle, and r is the distance from the axis of rotation.

blocks.text: In the case of a rigid body, the moment of inertia is the sum of the products of the masses of all the elements of the body and their perpendicular distances from the given axis.
